author: Anonymous Poet
title: why i get an error here?
question:
(require spd/tags)
;; yell-starter.rkt
; 
; PROBLEM:
; 
; DESIGN a function called yell that consumes strings like "hello" 
; and adds "!" to produce strings like "hello!".
; 
; Remember, when we say DESIGN, we mean follow the recipe.
; 
; Leave behind commented out versions of the stub and template.
; 

(@htdf yell)
(@signature String -> String)
;; produce the given string with "!" added to the end

(check-expect (yell hey) (string-append "hey" "!"))
(check-expect (yell there) (string-append "there" "!"))
;(define (yell a) "") ; stub
(@template String)
;(define (yell a) ; template
;  (... a))
(define (yell a)
  (string-append a "!"))
it's just highlighted . I dont get the correct result which is "Both tests passed!"
student_answer: sorry nevermind i just found it...
instructor_answer: To find bugs like this you want to start by identifying the error message. What does it say in this case?
